title: McDonnell's paranoid purge of Labour high command threatens to empower his moderate opponents
text:
Petty rivalries and competing egos will favour the hard-Left's opponents inside and outside the party

And then there was one. At least, there will be, if briefings about Len McCluskey’s imminent retirement turn out to be accurate. Of Jeremy Corbyn's closest allies, Seumas Milne will be the last comrade standing once Red Len, head of the Unite union, rides off into the reddest of sunsets to enjoy his pension.

Most ordinary voters will be blessedly unfamiliar with the latest round of hard-Left shenanigans in the Labour Party, rumours about people of whom they’ve never heard and wouldn’t recognise in a police line-up. But it’s important nonetheless, not just because Corbyn is losing allies but...
description: Petty rivalries and competing egos will favour the hard-Left's opponents inside and outside the party
